III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of Staff
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 10/15/23, a staff member moved a table out of the way so one
youth could fight another. Youth was not allowed in the bathroom
to clean up. Youth has a black eye, small abrasion on swollen
bottom lip, and swollen knuckles as a result of punching wall.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant/Occupational Therapist (OT) was interviewed
face to face at the facility on 10/18/23 in conjunction with
MDHHS Worker. OT reported Youth A came to her office on
10/16/23, reported the allegations and filled out a client’s rights
form. OT stated Youth A told her he was escalated after a verbal
dispute with a staff member (didn’t disclose which staff member)
after they searched his room. Youth A reported he went into the
milieu and took someone’s laptop but didn’t disclose whose laptop
it was or what he did with the laptop. OT stated Youth A told her
Youth B came into the milieu and told Youth A to stop being
disrespectful. Youth A reported Supervisor moved the table out of
the way so Youth A and Youth B could fight. Youth A told OT he
put his fists up but didn’t swing at Youth B. Youth A reported he
was punched by Youth B. Youth A stated he had bruises and
swollen knuckles on his hand from punching the wall by the
bathroom because he was frustrated Supervisor wouldn’t let him
in the bathroom to clean up. OT reported she read the fill-in log
from the unit after Youth A’s complaint, and it said Youth A was
watching an R-rated movie on a DVD player in his room. OT
reported there were R-rated movies in a bag in his room as well,
which might have been why his belongings were searched.
Program Manager (PM) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 10/18/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. PM
reported after the allegations were disclosed, Supervisor was put
on administrative leave pending investigation. PM reported Youth
A was assessed by medical staff on campus in the morning of
10/16/23 and his primary care physician off-campus later
10/16/23.
2

Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
10/18/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported
he was upset because Supervisor violated a boundary on
10/15/23. Youth A reported Supervisor came into his room and
started taking all his belongings for no reason. Youth A reported
Supervisor wouldn’t listen to anything he said, and then grounded
him for life. Youth A reported he was trying to write a letter to his
dad when Supervisor came into his room and started asking him
what was in random bags around his room. Youth A stated he
said, “why are you so nosey?”, but Supervisor took it the wrong
way and took everything from him (i.e., letter for his father,
technology, papers, and notebooks). Youth A reported when this
happened, he walked out of his room because he has trauma from
his dad taking his belongings and burning them in front of him.
Youth A reported he was talking to Staff 1, but it didn’t help. Youth
A reported while, he was talking to Staff 1, Youth B came up and
punched Youth A in the face. Youth A reported Staff 1 stepped
aside, and Supervisor moved the table, so the two youth could
continue fighting. Youth A reported staff are supposed to separate
youth who are fighting, but Staff 1 and Supervisor just sat and
watched. Youth A reported after Youth B punched him the first
time, he did it again. Youth A reported he swung back at Youth B
and thinks he grazed his face but wasn’t sure. Youth A reported
Staff 1 and Supervisor seemed eager to let Youth A and Youth B
fight because they weren’t helping or saying anything. Youth A
reported he said, “you guys are supposed to stop fights, why are
you just standing there watching?”, but they didn’t reply. Youth A
reported he walked away and tried to get into the bathroom to
wash the blood off, but it was locked, which was not normal. Youth
A reported he asked Staff 1 and Supervisor to unlock the
bathroom, but they didn’t respond or unlock it. Youth A reported
he punched the bathroom door with his right hand and then stood
in the corner by the bookshelf in the milieu for an hour crying and
waiting for someone to open the bathroom. Youth A reported
Supervisor told him to go to his room, but Youth A refused
because he didn’t feel safe in his room or anywhere on the unit.
Youth A reported when third shift staff came in (he wasn’t sure of
their names), he was able to receive Ibuprofen and clean himself
up in the bathroom. Youth A reported after he cleaned up, he went
to bed. Youth A reported Youth B never got in trouble or received
consequences for fighting. Youth A reported he is not sure what
provoked Youth B or why he hit him.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
10/18/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported
he was in the milieu and was irritated about an unrelated situation.
3

Youth B stated Youth A came out into the milieu and was also
irritated. Youth B reported Youth A took Supervisor’s laptop and
was being disrespectful towards Supervisor. Youth B reported he
didn’t like how Youth A was acting towards Supervisor, so while
Supervisor and Staff 1 were by the staff office, Youth B punched
Youth A twice and Youth A punched Youth B once. Youth B
reported Supervisor and Staff 1 immediately came over and
Supervisor said “stop, that’s enough”. Youth B reported Staff 1
held Youth B’s arm and escorted him into the staff office to
separate him from Youth A. Youth B reported he was told to stay
in the staff office for a couple minutes so they could calm Youth A
down. Youth B reported Youth A was standing by the bathroom
door, looking at the wall, but seemed calm. Youth B reported he
went back to his room and doesn’t know what happened after that.
Youth B reported Supervisor did not move the table so Youth A
and Youth B could fight. Youth B reported he was grounded from
outings for three days for fighting.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
10/18/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor
reported she conducted a room check on Youth A and he was in
the corner of his room with his hand and arm covering his DVD
player. Supervisor reported she opened his door and said “[Youth
A] what are you doing?” Supervisor reported Youth A responded,
“why are you so fucking nosey?” Supervisor reported she thought
his reaction was suspicious, so she asked what he was watching.
Youth A refused to allow Supervisor to see his screen and said, “I
don’t have to show you, this is my space”. Due to his behavior,
Supervisor reported there was enough suspicion to justify a room
search, so she and Staff 3 conducted one with Youth A present.
Supervisor reported they ended up confiscating 87 DVDs from his
room (43 were PG-13 and 44 were rated R). Supervisor reported
Youth A said he purchased them on outings and shopping trips,
so she talked to staff about doing a better job monitoring
purchases youth make. Supervisor stated they also found three
bags of candy wrappers, batteries, and electrical wires. Supervisor
told Youth A the items would be in his restriction bins. While
Supervisor was walking out of the room, Youth A had a bunch of
paper in his hand. Supervisor reported Youth A threw the paper in
her face and said, “since you want to steal my shit, here have all
of it”. Supervisor reported Youth B came out of his room when he
heard the commotion and yelling from Youth A and was trying to
encourage Youth A to do the right thing, so Youth B witnessed
Youth A hit her with the paper. Supervisor reported she told Youth
A “I have been nothing but nice to you” and walked away.
Supervisor reported she got her laptop and sat at a table in the
4

milieu typing notes. Supervisor reported Youth A came over to
her, stood over her and stared at her. After a few moments,
Supervisor said “What are you doing [Youth A]? You’re in my
space. Please give me space”. Supervisor reported Youth A didn’t
move and said “Feel my aura” over and over while staring at her.
Supervisor reported Youth A then grabbed her laptop away from
her, held it up in the air and said, “how does it feel for someone to
steal your stuff?”. Supervisor reported Youth B was in the milieu
and said “Dude stop. You hit [Supervisor] and now took her
laptop?”. Supervisor reported Youth B’s tone and verbal exchange
with Youth A seemed positive and encouraging in nature, so she
had no idea Youth A was going to hit Youth B. Supervisor
reported she retrieved her laptop out from under Youth A’s arm,
so he couldn’t use it as a weapon, and went to put the laptop in
the staff office. After she walked away, Supervisor reported Youth
B hit Youth A one time, so she ran back over and separated them.
Supervisor reported Youth A went and stood in a corner, facing
the wall, and cried for a while. Supervisor reported she and Staff 3
tried to talk to him and assess his injuries, but he wouldn’t talk to
them or let them see his face. Supervisor reported one time when
she checked on him, he said “the bible says don’t steal and to love
people, but you don’t do either of those, so you’re a hypocrite”.
Supervisor reported she could tell he was still upset because he
wasn’t reacting well to her, Staff 1, and Staff 3 when they tried
checking on him. Supervisor reported she tried to back off a bit
and give him some space so he wouldn’t be triggered further.
Supervisor stated when Staff 2 came in for third shift, Supervisor
asked Staff 2 to try and help Youth A since he wouldn’t let anyone
else help him. Staff 2 asked Youth A if she could assess him or if
he wanted ice, but he wouldn’t respond to Staff 2 either. After a
while, Supervisor said “[Youth A] can you please let someone help
you, even if it’s not me? Staff 2 and Staff 4 are both here. Please
let someone help you.” After she said that, Youth A reported he
wanted to go into the bathroom, so she let him go into the
bathroom to clean himself up. Supervisor reported that was the
first time she was able to see his injuries, which included swelling
and bruising around his eye. Supervisor noted Staff 2 saw Youth
A’s hand was also swollen, which they attributed to Youth A
punching Youth B during the altercation. Supervisor reported they
got him ice after he cleaned up. Supervisor reported Youth A
asked to talk to her in the staff office, so she agreed and asked
Staff 2 to join them. Supervisor reported Youth A apologized to
her and said the reason he responded how he did was because
his dad used to come in his room, take all his stuff away from him
and make him sit in a chair while his dad burned his belongings in
front of him. Supervisor reported she apologized to him for
5

triggering him and explained there needed to be communication
because she didn’t know what was going on. Supervisor reported
Youth A apologized again and said “I responded in a negative way
and reacted wrong. I’m not mad at you and I’m not even mad at
[Youth B] for hitting me and giving me a black eye.” Supervisor
reported he went to bed, and everything was fine. Supervisor
reported she checked on Youth A the next day, and everything
seemed fine then too. Supervisor reported she didn’t see Youth A
punch the wall or the bathroom door. Supervisor reported Youth A
only asked to enter the bathroom the one time right before he was
let in, and he was never denied access to the bathroom.
Supervisor reported at no point did she move the table so Youth A
and Youth B could fight each other.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 10/25/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported he was in the milieu
completing a shift fill-in log when he heard something going on in
the hallway. Staff 1 reported he didn’t know what happened in the
hallway or why Supervisor went into Youth A’s room initially. Staff
1 reported Youth A came into the milieu and was escalated, so
Staff 1 and Supervisor were monitoring him. Staff 1 reported
initially, Youth A went into a corner of the room and had his arms
crossed. Staff 1 reported then Youth A moved in front of
Supervisor, who was sitting at a table in the milieu doing work on
her computer. Staff 1 reported Youth A said, “I want you to feel my
aura” and then snatched Supervisor’s laptop off the table. Staff 1
reported Youth B was in the milieu and said, “you shouldn’t be
snatching stuff from [Supervisor] like that”. Staff 1 reported Youth
A got into a defensive karate-type stance and then Youth A and
Youth B said 1-2 sentences to each other before they began
fighting. Staff 1 reported they hit each other once or twice before
Staff 1 stepped in the middle of them and put his arms in between
them to stop them. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B
separated and continued to argue, but it didn’t get physical again.
Staff 1 reported Youth A went into the corner by the bookshelves
and stood there for a while. Staff 1 reported he checked on Youth
A and asked him how he was doing, but he wouldn’t respond.
Staff 1 reported Supervisor and Staff 2 also checked on Youth A
and asked him how he was doing, but he wouldn’t respond to
them either. Staff 1 reported Youth A never asked to go into the
bathroom after the fight, and if he would have asked, Staff 1 or
Supervisor would have let him in. Staff 1 reported he never saw
Youth A punch the wall or the door by the bathroom. Staff 1
reported Supervisor never moved the table so Youth A and Youth
B could fight.
6

Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 10/25/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported she worked third shift on
10/15/23 and came in around 10:30 pm. Staff 2 reported when
she came in, she noticed Youth A was standing facing a corner in
the milieu, so she asked Supervisor, Staff 1 and Staff 3 what was
going on. Supervisor told Staff 2 Youth A became upset about a
room search she conducted, and then Youth A and Youth B got
into a physical altercation. After about 10-15 minutes after Staff 2
arrived, Youth A was still standing in the corner, so she went to
check on him. Staff 2 reported she asked him if he needed
anything. Staff 2 reported Youth A was turned so she couldn’t see
his face and he was mumbling something, but she couldn’t hear
what he said. Staff 2 noticed there was some blood on the floor,
so she told Supervisor, and Supervisor asked Staff 2 to try to get
Youth A to talk and turn around, so they could check his injuries.
Staff 2 asked Youth A “where are you hurt so we can help you and
write up the incident report?”. Staff 2 reported Youth A turned
around and she could see his eye was swollen and he was
drooling a little bit. Staff 2 reported she asked if he wanted ice, but
he didn’t respond. Staff 2 reported she went to get ice, but there
wasn’t any in the freezer. Staff 2 reported she and Supervisor
were the only ones there at the time, and Supervisor said they had
to wait until Staff 4 arrived before they got ice from another unit.
Staff 2 reported Youth A finally agreed to get cleaned up, so they
let him into the bathroom, and he started cleaning himself up.
When Staff 4 arrived shortly after, they got ice for him, and he also
took Ibuprofen. After Youth A was cleaned up, he asked to talk to
Supervisor and Supervisor asked Staff 2 to come over as well.
Staff 2 reported Youth A told Supervisor he apologized for what he
did and said he was sorry for overreacting because of his past
trauma. Staff 2 reported Supervisor explained to Youth A she was
just trying to do her job and keep him safe. Staff 2 reported while
she was present, Youth A was never denied access to the
bathroom, and she never saw him punch the wall or door.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 10/25/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported Supervisor was doing
observation checks because the youth were all in their rooms.
Staff 3 reported he was cleaning up another part of the unit when
he heard Supervisor say they had to do a check on Youth A’s
room because he had items he shouldn’t have. Staff 3 and
Supervisor conducted a room search and found contraband (i.e.,
food, wrappers, DVDs, electronic items). Staff 3 reported
Supervisor reminded Youth A he knew the rules and knew he
couldn’t have these items. Youth A responded and called
Supervisor a hypocrite. Staff 3 reported Youth A alleged
7

Supervisor was just coming up with rules against him, but Staff 3
and Supervisor explained that wasn’t true because these are the
same rules for everyone. Staff 3 reported he took the items into
the milieu and sat at the table counting DVDs, and checking the
rating on each of the DVDs to see which ones were allowed and
which ones weren’t. Staff 3 reported Supervisor was sitting at a
different table in the milieu typing a report on her laptop. Staff 3
reported Youth A was pacing back and forth for a few minutes, but
then went over to Supervisor and stood over her for a while, which
was very strange. Staff 3 stated Supervisor asked Youth A to back
up out of her space and respect her boundaries, but instead Youth
A stayed there and said “feel my aura, feel my aura” over and
over. Staff 3 reported Youth A then snatched Supervisor’s laptop
off the table and started yelling “how do you like having things
stolen from you?”. Staff 3 reported Youth B was also in the milieu
and told Youth A “don’t snatch the laptop from [Supervisor], you
trippin”. Staff 3 reported Youth B then punched Youth A once in
the face. Staff 3 reported it happened very quick, but Staff 1 and
Supervisor immediately separated them. Staff 3 reported
Supervisor took Youth B out of the milieu area and Youth A
remained in the milieu. Staff 3 reported Youth A started saying,
“you guys were encouraging the fight. Why are you supporting
this? All of you are hypocrites.” Staff 3 reported he, Staff 1 and
Supervisor all tried to explain they had no idea that was going to
happen, but Youth A went and stood in the corner in the milieu.
Staff 3 reported he, Staff 1 and Supervisor all offered to help him
and asked if he wanted to get cleaned up, but he wouldn’t respond
and just continued to stand in the corner. Staff 3 reported Youth A
never asked to go into the bathroom, and Staff 3 never saw Youth
A punch the wall or bathroom door. Staff 3 reported Supervisor
never moved a table so Youth A and Youth B could fight.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Significant Event Report regarding incident on 10/15/23
authored by Supervisor is mostly consistent with
Supervisor’s interview. Report notes Youth A threw the
paper in Supervisor’s face prior to the room search, and
while the room search was being conducted, Youth A was
calling staff racist names. Report also notes Youth A
walked up to Youth B and tried to punch Youth B first.
Report does not note details about Youth A standing in a
corner, not responding to staff for a long period of time
before getting ice and cleaning himself up.
• Shift Fill-In Note dated 10/15/23 authored by Staff 1
summarized the incident. Note says after Youth A snatched
8

Supervisor’s laptop, Youth B asked Youth A not to talk to
Supervisor in a threatening voice. Youth A walked up on
Youth B with his hands up and attempted to hit Youth B,
which then led to an altercation. Staff were able to get
between them, but not before Youth A got hit in his eye. It
noted after the altercation, Youth A was in the milieu
refusing to go to bed, and talking about staff were going to
go to hell and talking about the bible. Note states staff were
giving Youth A space and monitoring his behavior.
• Client Concern or Complaint Form dated 10/16/23 authored
by Youth A was consistent with his interview.
• Nursing Note dated 10/16/23 (8:00 AM) authored by Nurse
notes Youth A had significant swelling surrounding his right
eye as well as swelling in his right hand. Referral was made
to Doctor to rule out concerns for any fracture or long-term
implication of injuries.
• Nursing Note dated 10/16/23 (12:16 PM) and Doctor
Progress Note dated 10/16/23 (1:07 PM) regarding visit
with Doctor state no fractures were suspected on Youth A’s
face or hand and to follow up with Ibuprofen as needed.
• Wedgwood Christian Services Behavior Management
Policy (rev. 2/28/18) states behaviors of youth can, without
intervention, threaten the safety and well-being of
themselves and others, so staff need to be prepared to
respond with a variety of interventions depending on the
situation. Interventions can include de-escalation
strategies, activation of individual self-control plans,
implementation of safety plans, and as a last resort,
implementation of physical behavior management
interventions.
• Staff 1 has no disciplinary records in his employee file. Staff
1 completed Calming Children in Crisis training on 4/14/20,
Communication and Conflict Management Skills training on
5/24/23, Intro to Crisis Prevention & De-Escalation training
on 4/17/20 and 6/2/23, and Crisis Prevention & De-
Escalation training on 4/21/20, 12/29/20, 4/20/21 and
9/25/23.
• Supervisor has no disciplinary records in her employee file.
Supervisor completed Calming Children in Crisis training on
2/9/19, and Crisis Management & De-Escalation training on
9

9/3/15, 3/24/16, 9/8/16, 3/6/17, 9/7/17, 4/12/18, 9/13/18,
3/26/19, 10/22/19, 4/21/20, 12/29/20, 4/20/21, 10/19/21,
4/11/22, 10/10/22, 3/27/23 and 9/25/23.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documentation reviewed, this
violation is not established. Youth B, Staff 1, Staff 3, and
Supervisor all reported Supervisor did not move a table so Youth
A and Youth B could fight. In addition, there is no evidence to
support Youth A’s claims staff encouraged the fight rather than
stopping it as Youth B, Staff 1, Staff 3, and Supervisor all reported
Supervisor and/or Staff 1 stepped in between the two youth and
stopped the altercation immediately. Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and
Supervisor all reported Youth A was never denied access to the
bathroom to clean up.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
